intro: Scaphochlamys pseudoreticosa, commonly known as the false nettle. It is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with a hairy texture. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often overlooked due to their modest appearance. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
